title: Why to honor only one player?
body:
I'm going through a bad time, seriously speaking, sometimes I play with teams that u  can´t say how to correct their mistakes because in their ego everything they do is perfect,they dont think like I die because i didnt buy armor because i want a full damage build like duskblade...and they return to the lane just to die more quicky because they refuse to play safe or counter with some build the enemy champ; players who do not work for the team but just for themselves..."kda bro", there is always someone who wants to splitpush , to divide the team and you have to fight vs that and make the team go with that guy instead of doing jungle objectives like baron or drake, u cant start baron sometimes because someone want to farm botlane and is a mistake but if u start baron and everyone die or the enemy steal that.... it ll be ur, and all the blame to u instead to the other guy,  it s ur  mistake because u made the call, they dont sacrifice some minions or tower for something better, however, also happen (rarely) the opposite, teams where I do not have to say anything and everything they do , is perfection, no more, no Less, just the perfection and it makes me feel bad sometimes that I can only give honor to one instead of all. 

It does not happen to you?

what do you think? 

Should RITO go back and make viable the honor to more than one?

replies.body: They don't mean much if you can give them out like candy.

it sounds like you are at a low elo where people have trouble itemizing properly, and aren't adept at changing their play-style.

I don't understand how this relates to honor, but if you want to give out more honor, I would  suggest asking riot to bring back the honorable opponent feature.

Yeah they definitely need to add being able to honor more than one, and an opponent. Or, they could have the main honor like it is now, and then honorable mentions, like it used to be, where you hit the honor category during lobby. They don't really count as much as the main honor, but they do get tallied up like the old honor. I'd like to see that, personally.

Honestly there have been times where I believed the honor should have gone to more than one person. Just like in real life, any type of Team Based Game deserves to honor more than one person. As it is a team game and more often than not it wasn't just one person that helped in the long run. While i do miss it, i can understand with how the do honors now, it would have just made things worse and basically gone back to how the old honors were had they made it be able to honor everyone.
